org.apache.felix.dm.lambda

Interface BundleAdapterBuilder

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ComponentBuilder<BundleAdapterBuilder>

    public interface BundleAdapterBuilder
extends ComponentBuilder<BundleAdapterBuilder>
    Builds a Dependency Manager bundle adapter. The adapter created by this builder will be applied to any bundle that matches the specified bundle state mask and filter condition. For each matching bundle an adapter service will be created based on the adapter implementation class. The adapter will be registered with the specified interface and existing properties from the original bundle plus any extra properties you supply here. The bundle is injected by reflection in adapter class fields having a Bundle type, or using a callback method that you can specify.

    Example which creates a BundleAdapter service for each started bundle (the bundle is added by reflection on a class field that has a "Bundle" type): 

     
 public class Activator extends DependencyManagerActivator {
     public void activate() throws Exception { 
       bundleAdapter(adapt -> adapt
           .impl(BundleAdapterImpl.class)
           .provides(BundleAdapter.class)
           .mask(Bundle.INSTALLED | Bundle.RESOLVED | Bundle.ACTIVE));
    }
 }
    Example that creates a BundleAdapter service for each started bundle (the bundle is added using a method reference): 
     
 public class Activator extends DependencyManagerActivator {
     public void activate() throws Exception { 
       bundleAdapter(adapt -> adapt
           .impl(BundleAdapterImpl.class)
           .provides(BundleAdapter.class)
           .mask(Bundle.INSTALLED | Bundle.RESOLVED | Bundle.ACTIVE)
           .cb(BundleAdapterImpl::setBundle));
    }
 }
    Example that creates a BundleAdapter service for each started bundle (the bundle is added using a method name): 
     
 public class Activator extends DependencyManagerActivator {
     public void activate() throws Exception { 
       bundleAdapter(adapt -> adapt
           .impl(BundleAdapterImpl.class)
           .provides(BundleAdapter.class)
           .mask(Bundle.INSTALLED | Bundle.RESOLVED | Bundle.ACTIVE)
           .cb("setBundle"));
    }
 }

    • Method Detail

      • mask

        BundleAdapterBuilder mask(int mask)
        Sets the bundle state mask to depend on. The OSGi BundleTracker explains this mask in more detail, but it is basically a mask with flags for each potential state a bundle can be in.
        Parameters:
        mask - the mask to use
        Returns:
        this builder

      • filter

        BundleAdapterBuilder filter(java.lang.String filter)
        Sets the filter condition to depend on. Filters are matched against the full manifest of a bundle.
        Parameters:
        filter - the filter condition
        Returns:
        this builder

      • propagate

        BundleAdapterBuilder propagate(boolean propagate)
        Sets property propagation. If set to true any bundle manifest properties will be added to the service properties of the component that has this dependency (if it registers as a service).
        Parameters:
        propagate - true to propagate the bundle manifest properties
        Returns:
        this builder

      • propagate

        BundleAdapterBuilder propagate()
        Enables property propagation. Any bundle manifest properties will be added to the service properties of the component that has this dependency (if it registers as a service).
        Returns:
        this builder

      • cb

        BundleAdapterBuilder cb(java.lang.String... callbacks)
        Sets some callbacks invoked on the component implementation instances. When a bundle state matches the bundle adapter filter, then the bundle is injected using the specified callback methods. When you specify one callback, it stands for the "add" callback. When you specify two callbacks, the first one corresponds to the "add" callback, and the second one to the "remove" callback. When you specify three callbacks, the first one stands for the "add" callback, the second one for the "change" callback, and the third one for the "remove" callback.
        Parameters:
        callbacks - a list of callbacks (1 param : "add", 2 params : "add"/remove", 3 params : "add"/"change"/"remove").
        Returns:
        this builder

      • cbi

        BundleAdapterBuilder cbi(java.lang.Object callbackInstance,
                         java.lang.String... callbacks)
        Sets some callback instance methods invoked on a given Object instance. When a bundle state matches the bundle adapter filter, then the bundle is injected using the specified callback methods. When you specify one callback, it stands for the "add" callback. When you specify two callbacks, the first one corresponds to the "add" callback, and the second one to the "remove" callback. When you specify three callbacks, the first one stands for the "add" callback, the second one for the "change" callback, and the third one for the "remove" callback.
        Parameters:
        callbackInstance - the Object instance where the callbacks are invoked on
        callbacks - a list of callbacks (1 param : "add", 2 params : "add"/remove", 3 params : "add"/"change"/"remove").
        Returns:
        this builder

      • cb

        <T> BundleAdapterBuilder cb(CbTypeBundle<T> add)
        Sets a callback invoked on a component implementation instance when a bundle is added. The method reference must point to a Component implementation class method, and take as argument a Bundle.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the component instance class on which the callback is invoked.
        Parameters:
        add - the method reference invoked when a bundle is added.
        Returns:
        this builder

        Parameters:

        remove - the method reference invoked when a bundle is removed.
